intro: Canthium diplodiscus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Canthium diplodiscus produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal by wind.
